content.title: Chargie for Laptops March tech update - delivery timeline
content.creator:
Ovidiu Sandru
March 6, 2025
content.content:
Dear Backer,
Over the past month, we've refined everything that worked best so far. Now, all that's left is to improve the thermal efficiency of the device and thoroughly test it in various scenarios. The almost-100W device (93, to be more precise) is a completely different beast in what regards thermals. Every part has to be perfectly matched to this power level, otherwise mess starts to happen. I even considered limiting the thing to just 60W, but I'm taking the challenge of making it work as promised.
The new Chargie device will also support phones using high-quality, laptop-grade PD adapters capable of delivering 9V, 12V, 15V, and 20V. If your phone wants it (like the iPhone 16 Pro Max), but your adapter doesn't support one of these voltages, the device will automatically revert to 5V. For laptops, this isn't an issue, as most already use compatible power supplies that provide 15V or 20V. Keep in mind Chargie for Laptops was designed primarily for laptops, using it with phones is an extra wonderful perk for this Kickstarter campaign.
Additionally, original Apple or Samsung adapters are fully compatible and will seamlessly charge your phone through Chargie.
You'll also have the option to slow-charge your phone when you're not in a hurry (similar to the Chargie C Basic), or configure the app to automatically scale back charging to 5V/3A if the phone gets too hot (the current Chargie C Basic only cuts off power completely).
Below is the latest prototype actively running on my desk around the clock, closely monitored by an excellent PD analyzer from ST. Targeting April 10 for delivery start. There's so much to do on so many fronts, but I'm really excited about how it's turning out!
Have a happy and sunny March! :) 
Ovidiu.
P.S. If you'd like more units, feel free to order - I've not closed the Late Pledge yet. I'm working hard to find an ultra-affordable shipping option for US and EU (around $2 or $3) and aim to offer free shipping for orders containing bulk packs. It's not final yet, but there's a high chance this will happen.

content.title: Thank you for an incredible campaign!
content.creator:
Ovidiu Sandru
January 10, 2025
content.content:
Dear Backers,
Thank you for joining us on this incredible journey! Today marks the final day of our first Kickstarter project, and we couldn’t be more grateful for your support. Reaching $105K in backings has been no easy feat, and we are fully committed to honoring each of your pledges with the highest quality product.
Throughout December, we've been tirelessly working to refine Chargie for Laptops. This includes improvements to the app, firmware, hardware, thermal efficiency, safety, ease of use, and cost. Balancing these advancements with marketing efforts has been challenging, as real-world testing takes time. Over the past month, we've prototyped multiple ideas in parallel, invested heavily in shipping fees, and conducted rigorous testing. Except for Christmas Day, there hasn’t been much of a break—but it’s all been worth it. 
As a result, our delivery timeline has shifted by a couple of weeks to ensure we provide you with a complete and polished product. Here’s what we’ve learned along the way:
Slower charging is better. Avoid charging at 100+ watts to significantly extend your battery's lifespan.
Most charging sessions require only 30-60W. Maximum charging speeds are often unnecessary for laptops that remain plugged in most of the time.
Cycle your battery between 40-60%. This ensures maximum battery life and efficiency. Our scheduler will allow you to top it up when needed.
If you’d like to order additional Chargies or help us reach a milestone of $110K, now is the perfect time! Every extra contribution fuels more research and helps us develop even better products for you.
We’ll keep you updated with the exciting advancements we’re working on, one step at a time. Thank you for being a vital part of this journey.
Cheers,
Ovidiu

comments.text: Hello Ovidiu, My initials are DDH. I’m from DeKalb, IL., in the U.S. I’m a Backer of a ‘Chargie, Early Bird Double Pack (2pcs).’ Unfortunately, it has become too apparent that the acquisition of his & hers sets of ‘Optional add-ons’ are most necessary. Those being: (2) pair [total 4 cables] ‘Very Short 4” (10cm) USB-C cable; (1) set ‘the 4.5mm DELL male + DELL female barrel connector adapters’; and (1) set ‘the 7.4mm DELL male + DELL female barrel connector adapters.’ These items were totally and most sadly overlooked when pledging earlier. Shall we have ourselves a dialog on how to close on a purchase of these cables/adapters, to have them included with the Chargie(s)? Thanking you in advance, and good luck. Doug
Please tell me the range will be customisable. 40% to 60% is not the optimal range for modern batteries, so it's critical that it's possible to change that, otherwise the device is useless.

You can use any range you want. Just set the limit at the desired charge limit (x) and the Allowed Charge Drop (c). The charge will bounce between x and x-c. MId-range is always better for any battery, produces less stress.

The research I've been able to find says that 25% to 85% is optimal for the battery life of modern lithium ion batteries. So knowing I'll be able to set it to something other than 30% to 60% is critical for the value of the product.

Thanks for the clear update! Can't wait to test these!

content.title: Chargie for Laptops is now fully funded!
content.creator:
Ovidiu Sandru
November 28, 2024
content.content:
We did it, folks!
Chargie has reached its $15k goal! It is going to get funded thanks to each of you!
Share this project with your social media friends and followers and let's take it to the next level!
$50k is the next stretch goal! I have big plans with this little device and I am going to share them as things progress. 
One day, Chargie might become a self-regulating system with the charging experience of the whole network. You'll be able to share your charging habits with the network and it will predict the level of degradation after X months of usage. But that takes development money and time, which is why I resorted to crowdfunding.
Be a part of huge CO2 and resource savings and have the huge satisfaction of a job well done! Tell your friends about our mission!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/chargie-laptops/chargie-preserve-your-laptops-battery-health/
Happy Thanksgiving!
Ovidiu
